forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 48. West wind around 6 mph.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, a thick blanket of clouds hangs low, casting a muted light that seems to soften the contours of the city. The air is cool, creeping towards the evening, and as the afternoon wanes, temperatures inch down to around 54 degrees. The gentle whisper of a southwest breeze carries a hint of moisture, a reminder that the fog is never far in this maritime metropolis. Currently, the skyline emerges only faintly through the haze, as the city appears to sway in and out of clarity, the promise of a feigned sun cloaked by the dampness of a West Coast evening.

As night descends, expect mostly cloudy skies, with a low settling around 48 degrees, calling for layers to keep the gentle chill at bay. A classic wind from the west adds a brisk note to the air, a perfect prompt to pull on a cozy cardigan or scarf before heading out. This is not the kind of day for grand outdoor escapades; rather, it’s ideal for strolling through the softer side of the city—perhaps a quiet visit to a local café, curling up with a book, or wandering through the fog-veiled streets, letting the soothing murmur of the Bay guide your thoughts. The evening’s embrace suggests a warm drink, perhaps, to cradle in your hands as you watch the world wrap itself in evening hues.
